description:
Chitinophaga defluvii is a species of bacteria that belongs to the phylum Bacteroidetes. It is a Gram-negative, non-spore-forming, and aerobic bacterium. Chitinophaga defluvii is known to be chemoorganotrophic, meaning it obtains its energy and carbon from organic compounds.

This species was originally isolated from wastewater treatment plant sludge. It is characterized by its ability to degrade chitin, a complex polysaccharide found in the exoskeletons of many invertebrates and the cell walls of fungi. The genome of Chitinophaga defluvii has been sequenced, providing insights into its metabolic capabilities and potential roles in environmental processes.

Chitinophaga defluvii is considered a member of the normal microbial community in various environmental habitats, including soil, freshwater, and wastewater treatment systems, where it may contribute to the degradation of organic matter and nutrient cycling.
